meanings.definition: The state or quality of being putrid.
meanings.sent1: The putridity of the garbage made everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent2: The putridity of the meat was evident from the foul smell emanating from it.
meanings.sent3: The putridity of the milk was so strong that even the cat refused to drink it.
meanings.sent4: The putridity of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over the room.
meanings.sent5: The putridity of the swamp was so intense that it could be smelled from miles away.

meanings.definition: The condition of being decayed or decomposed.
meanings.sent1: The putridity of the fruit attracted a swarm of flies.
meanings.sent2: The putridity of the old wood was evident from its crumbling texture.
meanings.sent3: The putridity of the leftovers in the fridge was a reminder to clean it out regularly.
meanings.sent4: The putridity of the abandoned house gave it an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The putridity of the compost heap was a sign of its effectiveness in breaking down organic matter.

meanings.definition: The offensive smell or taste of something rotten.
meanings.sent1: The putridity of the sewage plant was overwhelming to anyone nearby.
meanings.sent2: The putridity of the fish market made many customers hold their breath.
meanings.sent3: The putridity of the cheese was so strong that it could be smelled from the other room.
meanings.sent4: The putridity of the garbage dump was a stark reminder of the need for proper waste management.
meanings.sent5: The putridity of the decaying fruit bowl made it a favorite spot for fruit flies to gather.
